intro: Lacmellea arborescens, commonly known as the tree moss, is a unique member of the family Lejeuneaceae. It is a small, epiphytic liverwort that typically grows on tree trunks and branches in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive, branching structure with a central stem and lateral shoots that form a dense, moss-like appearance. Its leaves are closely arranged and have a delicate, translucent quality. Lacmellea arborescens is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, forested habitats.
